CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: In the out - of - plane of PQCDTB , as shown Figure 1a , a sharp diffraction peak was observed at 4.0 , 8.1 , 12.2 ° , which indicates the formation of ordered lamellar structure as an out - of - plane peak ( h00 ) by the alkyl side chain of quinacridone and conventional edge-on πstacking. 5,14,23 The lamellar d-spacing ( d 1 ) was 21.8 Å ( λ = 2d[sin θ ] ). In the ( 010 ) in-plane pattern related to π-π stacking , as shown Figure 1b , a broad diffraction peak was detected at approximately 24.0 ° . Using the same calculation , the π-π stacking distance ( d π ) was 3.7 Å. The results are similar to thiophene and thiophene - fused aromatic system polymers that perform well as OPVs. 19,25 In the out - of - plane of PCZDTB , as shown in Figure 1a , no diffraction peak was observed in the thin film. As reported before , a broad diffraction peak was observed at approximately 20.5 ° in the diffraction of powdery PCZDTB ( see Supporting Information ). 26 The π-π stacking distance ( d π ) was 4.3 Å. The result was similar to the result for π-π stacking ( d π = 4.0 - 4.4 Å ) of fluorene-thiophene. The benzene-thiophene linkage has a twisted structure compared with the thiophenethiophene linkage. The structure has an impact on π-π stacking ( d π ) as well. 27 By calculating PCZDTB and PQCDTB using a density functional theory ( DFT ) calculation , the tilt angle has been comparatively analyzed. In terms of tilt angle , PCZDTB was 27-28 ° , while PQCDTB was 19-21 ° . Compared with PCZDTB , formation of a planar backbone and stronger π-π stacking were observed in PQCDTB ( see Supporting Information ). On the basis of this result , it has been confirmed that π-π stacking was more effective in PQCDTB than in PCZDTB because of coplanarity of the quinacridone unit that was introduced to the main chain of PQCDTB. 13 Figure 2 showed the UV - visible spectra of PQCDTB and PCZDTB. As shown in Figure 2 , the maximum absorption peak of PQCDTB ( λ max ) was observed at 389 and 539 nm , respectively , in solution ( 10^-6 M in chloroform ). On the other hand , the maximum absorption peaks of PCZDTB ( λ max ) were observed at 386 and 514 nm in solution. The band around 380 nm in the absorption spectra of PQCDTB and PCZDTB can be assigned to π-π* transition whereas the 530-550 band are due to intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ) between donor and acceptor moieties. 10 The absorption spectrum of PQCDTB is broadened and red - shifted compared to that of PCZDTB. This can be explained by the much stronger ICT effects in the PQCDTB than that in PCZDTB.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PQCDTB |
| PCZDTB |
| Quinacridone |
| Thiophene |
| Thiophene-fused aromatic system polymers |
| Fluorene-thiophene |
| Benzene-thiophene |

Note: The material names are presented precisely as they appear in the original paragraph, with no corrections or adjustments made to the spelling or punctuation.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PQCDTB |
| PCZDTB |
| Quinacridone |
| Thiophene |

Note: The other mentioned entities, such as "fluorene-thiophene" and "benzene-thiophene", do not clearly refer to material names and were therefore removed.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| 4.0° | Diffraction peak angle in out-of-plane of PQCDTB |
| 8.1° | Diffraction peak angle in out-of-plane of PQCDTB |
| 12.2° | Diffraction peak angle in out-of-plane of PQCDTB |
| 21.8 Å | Lamellar d-spacing (d1) in PQCDTB |
| 24.0° | Diffraction peak angle in (010) in-plane pattern of π-π stacking in PQCDTB |
| 3.7 Å | π-π stacking distance (dπ) in PQCDTB |
| 20.5° | Diffraction peak angle in powdery PCZDTB |
| 4.3 Å | π-π stacking distance (dπ) in PCZDTB |
| 27-28° | Tilt angle of PCZDTB |
| 19-21° | Tilt angle of PQCDTB |
| 389 nm | Maximum absorption peak (λmax) of PQCDTB in solution |
| 539 nm | Maximum absorption peak (λmax) of PQCDTB in solution |
| 386 nm | Maximum absorption peak (λmax) of PCZDTB in solution |
| 514 nm | Maximum absorption peak (λmax) of PCZDTB in solution |

Note: The units for the diffraction peak angles are degrees (°), while the units for the d-spacing and π-π stacking distance are angstroms (Å). The units for the absorption peaks are wavelengths (nm).

The following entities do not clearly refer to "Value of material property":

* Tilt angles (27-28°, 19-21°)
* Absorption peaks (389 nm, 539 nm, 386 nm, 514 nm)

These entities are not directly related to the value of a material property, but rather describe the characteristics of the materials' structures and interactions.
